page.title: 13 HOUSING
page.content: The housing in this area varies mainly between housing estates and old stone houses,some of which have been renovat- ed.Housing estates are mainly situated in Rainford,but there are also small groups of houses throughout the region. The housing in the country areas is mostly farmhouses - many dating back to the 17th Century.These are of local sandstone,but many have been covered with cement stucco and extensively modernised.Crow's Nest Farm,now very modernised,used to be a cafe in the nineteen thirties,when Shaley Brow was very popular for outings.A mill also used to stand on this site,of which the millpond and millstone still exist as garden features.Some of the houses are listed buildings and therefore cannot be altered.The people in this area are well housed and have modern amenities.
